title: Quiz 3: ICCM Assessment
description: Assess your skills in Integrated Community Case Management (iCCM), focusing on identifying danger signs and assessing sick children.

questions.question: Order the general steps for assessing a sick child:

items.text: Look at child for signs of illness

questions.explanation: First rapport (greet), then history (ask), then exam (look), then documentation (record).
questions.hint: It starts with communication and ends with documentation.

questions.question: Which of the following are considered GENERAL DANGER SIGNS in a sick child? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Danger signs are vomiting everything, convulsions, lethargy/unconsciousness, and inability to feed. A simple cough is not a general danger sign.
questions.hint: These signs indicate severe illness requiring referral.

questions.question: For a child aged 12 months up to 5 years, fast breathing is defined as ___BLANK___ breaths or more per minute.
questions.explanation: Cut-off points: 2-12 months is 50 bpm; 12 months-5 years is 40 bpm.
questions.hint: The rate decreases as the child gets older.

questions.question: What does 'Chest in-drawing' indicate in a sick child with a cough?
questions.explanation: Chest in-drawing (lower chest wall moves in when child breathes in) is a sign of severe pneumonia.

questions.question: Match the condition with its correct assessment criteria:

pairs.right: 3 or more loose stools in 24 hours
Hot to touch or reported history
Count breaths for one full minute

questions.explanation: Diarrhea is defined by frequency/consistency; Fever by touch/history; Breathing by counting; Malaria by test.
questions.hint: How do you confirm each condition?

questions.question: When assessing for fever, if the caregiver does not know if the child has a fever, you should check by feeling the child's hands and feet.
questions.explanation: You should feel the child's forehead, stomach, or underarm. Extremities like hands/feet can be cold even with fever.
questions.hint: Where is core body temperature best estimated by touch?

questions.question: Rapid Diagnostic Tests (RDTs) for malaria typically provide results in approximately how many minutes?
questions.explanation: RDTs provide results in about 20 minutes (reading usually between 15-20 mins).
questions.hint: It's less than half an hour.

questions.question: Review the scenario below. What is the correct classification for this child?

richContent.content: Child Assessment: A 3-year-old child presents with a cough. You count 45 breaths per minute. There is no chest in-drawing and no general danger signs.

questions.explanation: The child is 3 years old (cut-off is 40 bpm). 45 bpm is fast breathing. Fast breathing without danger signs = Pneumonia.
questions.hint: Compare the breath count to the age-specific cut-off.

questions.question: A child is considered to be 'vomiting everything' if:

options.text: They are not able to hold anything down at all

questions.explanation: The sign 'vomits everything' means the child cannot hold anything down. This is confirmed by offering a drink/breastfeed.

questions.question: What are the roles of CHVs in iCCM? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Identify symptoms and signs of illness
Help families treat minor illnesses at home
Refer very sick children to health facilities

questions.explanation: CHVs identify signs, treat minor illnesses, refer severe cases, and provide health education. They do not perform surgery.
